comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Trees block the view in StreetView

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content: That's the Church of Ireland Church in Tralee - dedicated to St John the Evangelist. It's located on Ashe Street.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: There's a pub around the corner from this church that sells electric blue cocktails for EUR8 a pitcher, as a result of which I can remember very little about Tralee (or what the cocktail is called), even though I got a detailed tour of the place from a local, including highlights such as the courthouse, where his mother got done for not paying her TV license as part of some sort of gaeilgeoir dispute, and a house that used to be a shop where his mother once bought a pair of shoes.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: The photo is of Church Terrace rather than Nelson or Ashe Street!,

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] You're dead right, Danny. Only spotted that on closer examination of Street View - now added as a tag (and in the title).
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
